alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 9:14PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Glacier dammed Hidden Lake near McCarthy is currently releasing. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR HIDDEN LAKE GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...Kennicott River near McCarthy. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM AKDT, Hidden Lake, which is dammed by the Kennicott Glacier, has begun to release and will cause a significant rise on the Kennicott River at McCarthy. The Kennicott River water levels prior to the release were at 1343 feet on the river gage. Expect water levels on the Kennicott River to rise an additional 3 to 7 feet over the next 24 to 48 hours. This is a yearly event that occurs in mid to late summer. Persons living or traveling in the vicinity of the Kennicott River are urged to prepare for rapidly rising water and possible minor flooding and bank erosion during the next several days. Persons traveling for recreation should avoid parking or camping in low lying areas near the Kennicott River. The Chitina and Copper Rivers will experience moderate rises in water levels as the glacier dammed outburst progresses downstream. - For Kennicott River near McCarthy: At 8:15pm the stage was 1345.73 feet. Flood Stage is 1350.0 feet. Impacts: At 1347.0 feet: Bankfull stage. At 1350.0 feet: Minor flood stage. Water begins to impact the campground upstream of the bridge. Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
